p: Although technologies like LC-MS/MS and 2-DE-gel have been used to study the protein composition of E. granulosus at a certain developmental stage [ 9, 54, 59], and extended the existing proteomic data [ 13], there are few reports on the regular pattern of the screened proteins during the consecutive development of the parasites. This study could help in understanding how E. granulosus adapts to its different and complex parasitic life cycles, and universal molecules among diverse groups of cestodes to escape from host immune response.
